definition: to open a business/first transaction of a business day

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: The last was opened in Dalian in Liaoning province in February this year.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一家去年二月在遼寧大連開張。

sentences.english: I'm going to that new Cantonese restaurant tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我明天會去那家新開張的粵式餐廳。

sentences.english: Welcome to the official launch by IBM of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨IBM上海公司的正式開張典禮。

sentences.english: That’s like a parking ticket to me.
sentences.chinese: 就像開張停車罰單那麼簡單。

sentences.english: After that, we went to a local garment shop, the one just opened last month.
sentences.chinese: 那之後，我們去了一家上個月剛開張的衣店。

sentences.english: "Sum, just- opened, have no how much human know" employer the Han Han smile.
sentences.chinese: “額，剛開張的，沒有多少人知道”老闆憨憨的笑着。

sentences.english: Opened just did not expect the police seized 10 days.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到開張剛10天就被警方查獲。

sentences.english: Nine new franchised stores opened, including seven in China.
sentences.chinese: 在九家新開張的專賣店中，中國佔了七家。

sentences.english: To expand its appeal, Samsung is opening an app store.
sentences.chinese: 爲了擴大其號召力，三星的應用商店正在開張。

sentences.english: Upscale shops once again line the famous avenue Unter den Linden.
sentences.chinese: 高檔商店再次在著名的菩提樹下大道開張。

sentences.english: Creative ads for McDonald's re-opening in Birkerod, Finland.
sentences.chinese: 麥當勞在芬蘭，比爾卡羅德的重新開張的創意廣告。

sentences.english: Today the opening of a new house, all predecessors of the exhibitions…
sentences.chinese: 今天小屋新開張，請各位前輩們多多指教了。

sentences.english: The second week of business, locals say, has been worryingly slow.
sentences.chinese: 然而當地人說，開張的第二週生意卻不盡人意。

sentences.english: 1809 - Royal Opera House in London opens.
sentences.chinese: 1809年的今天，位於倫敦的皇家歌劇院開張。

sentences.english: A positive sign was how many Israeli VC firms were opening their doors.
sentences.chinese: 一個積極的跡象就是看有幾家以色列的風投公司開張。

sentences.english: O you give good notice indeed, you bell by the sea-reefs ringing.
sentences.chinese: 哦唔預告真好開張，海礁吼聲亮胸膛。

restaurant
to finish school, esp. a short course/to complete a course
